content: What classic American novel, written by Harper Lee, tells the story of Scout Finch and her father Atticus?

The classic American novel you're referring to is "To Kill a Mockingbird," written by Harper Lee. It was published in 1960 and has since become a staple of modern American literature. The story is set in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama, during the Great Depression. It focuses on the young protagonist, Scout Finch, and her father, Atticus Finch, who is a lawyer defending a black man falsely accused of raping a white woman. The novel explores themes of racial injustice, moral growth, and the loss of innocence. It has received widespread critical acclaim and has been translated into many languages.
